title: Amazon video unavailable now repaired
content: Windvine Content Description Module updated - problem fixed. I had alternately disabled both Windvine and OpenH264 Video Codex, closed and restarted FireFox with no success. This AM, I updated Windvine, closed and reopened FireFox. Amazon Prime video now works very well. Thanks for your trouble shooting tips ! OS Monterey 12.7 FireFox 118.0.2 PS: FF Tab Manager has returned speedy browsing. Horray !

title: Is there another addon similar to this?
content:
I use All Tabs Helper

Unfortunately, it's no longer being supported, and as such, there's couple new features/improvements/bugs that won't be addressed. I'm hopig there is another app out there that can perform some of the same tasks.

It can be displayed from a toolbar drop down menu. I prefer it in the popup window mode (see image)

I find taht popup window particularly useful when there's a ton of tabs, being able to far more conveniently scroll thru your tabs as if they were files in a "File Explorer" type of directory environment, with, for instance, the ability to search, move/close tabs, in bulk, if you wish. Another nice feature is a 'CSS" field in the settings to customize the interface, i.e. make the fonts bolder & alter their size.

It's supposed to open up to the active tab, but that's one of the things that no longer work, as well as other issues.
creator: noel_envoide

Please email me: [removed email from public support forum] with a response.

title: Firefox won't start at all
content:
First, I tried to install via the web download from mozilla.org. That led to the wont-start-up problem. Then I reinstalled and reset my computer, and had the same problem. Then I uninstalled and reinstalled via the microsoft store, and that worked fine, and got my browser set up. That was all yesterday. Today, I tried to open firefox, and it once again wouldn't start. I'm pretty sure I shut down my computer overnight between yesterday and today. So, I uninstalled and reinstalled via the microsoft store. Here's the *really* weird part: today, when trying to launch firefox, windows will instead open a different program, seemingly at random. When launching firefox, it has instead launched:

  • Audacity
  • Some AMD software thing
  • Calculator
  • Microsoft office

It won't open even if I try to open it in troubleshoot mode. I tried to find the crash logs file in my system that some support article recommended I find, and windows couldn't find that file. No error message or dialogue box appears when firefox crashes on start. I'm running windows 11 on an amd gpu and cpu. Help me not use google anymore!
creator: hnonnemaker

title: Wrong tab in focus after pulling different tab away
content:
If I have many tabs open, and pull one away, instead of the previous tab saying in focus, it clicks to a different tab.

If I have 5 tabs open:

  1. Tab1
  2. Tab 2
  3. Tab 3
  4. Tab 4
  5. Tab 5

I'm focused on Tab 3. If I pull Tab 5 away, it snaps me into Tab 4 even though I was previously on a different tab.

I think this isn't a bug but not desired?
